description: Darier-White Disease, also known as keratosis follicularis, is a rare genetic skin disorder that causes rough, bumpy patches on the skin. It is characterized by abnormal growth of skin cells and can lead to a variety of skin issues.
possible causes: Inherited genetic mutation in the ATP2A2 gene
symptoms: Rough, bumpy patches on the skin
treatments: Topical medications to reduce skin inflammation
Oral retinoids to help control symptoms
